content: 1 James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ,— Unto the twelve tribes that are in the dispersion Wishes joy.
content_old: 1 James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ,— Unto the twelve tribes that are in the dispersion Wishes joy.

content: 2 All joy account it､ my brethren､ whensoever ye fall in with manifold temptations,—
content_old: 2 All joy account it､ my brethren､ whensoever ye fall in with manifold temptations,—

content: 3 Taking note､ that the proving of your faith worketh out endurance;
content_old: 3 Taking note､ that the proving of your faith worketh out endurance;

content: 4 But let your endurance have mature work, That ye may be mature and complete､ In nothing coming short.
content_old: 4 But let your endurance have mature work, That ye may be mature and complete､ In nothing coming short.

content: 5 But if any of you is coming short of wisdom Let him be asking of God､ Who giveth unto all freely and upbraideth not, And it shall be given him;
content_old: 5 But if any of you is coming short of wisdom Let him be asking of God､ Who giveth unto all freely and upbraideth not, And it shall be given him;

content: 6 But let him be asking in faith､ nothing doubting, For he that doubteth is like a wave of the sea､ wind-driven and storm-tossed,—
content_old: 6 But let him be asking in faith､ nothing doubting, For he that doubteth is like a wave of the sea､ wind-driven and storm-tossed,—

content: 7 For let not that man think that he shall receive anything from the Lord—
content_old: 7 For let not that man think that he shall receive anything from the Lord—

content: 8 A two-souled man､ unstable in all his ways.
content_old: 8 A two-souled man､ unstable in all his ways.

content: 9 But boasting be the lowly brother in his uplifting;
content_old: 9 But boasting be the lowly brother in his uplifting;

content: 10 Whereas the rich､ in his being brought low,— Because as a flower of grass he will pass away;
content_old: 10 Whereas the rich､ in his being brought low,— Because as a flower of grass he will pass away;

content: 11 For the sun hath sprung up､ with its scorching heat, And hath withered the grass､ And the flower thereof hath fallen out､ And the beauty of the face thereof hath perished,— So also the rich､ in his goings､ shall languish.
content_old: 11 For the sun hath sprung up､ with its scorching heat, And hath withered the grass､ And the flower thereof hath fallen out､ And the beauty of the face thereof hath perished,— So also the rich､ in his goings､ shall languish.

content: 12 Happy the man who endureth temptation! Because becoming approved he shall receive the crown of life— Which he hath promised unto them that love him.
content_old: 12 Happy the man who endureth temptation! Because becoming approved he shall receive the crown of life— Which he hath promised unto them that love him.

content: 13 Let no one､ while tempted be saying— From God am I tempted,— For God cannot be tempted by things evil, And himself tempteth no one;
content_old: 13 Let no one､ while tempted be saying— From God am I tempted,— For God cannot be tempted by things evil, And himself tempteth no one;

content: 14 But each one is tempted､ when by his own coveting he is drawn out and enticed,
content_old: 14 But each one is tempted､ when by his own coveting he is drawn out and enticed,

content: 15 Then､ the coveting having conceived giveth birth to sin, And the sin when full-grown bringeth forth death.
content_old: 15 Then､ the coveting having conceived giveth birth to sin, And the sin when full-grown bringeth forth death.

content: 16 Be not deceived､ my brethren beloved:—
content_old: 16 Be not deceived､ my brethren beloved:—

content: 17 Every good giving､ and every perfect gift is from above､ Coming down from the Father of lights— With whom is no alternation､ Nor shadow cast by turning:
content_old: 17 Every good giving､ and every perfect gift is from above､ Coming down from the Father of lights— With whom is no alternation､ Nor shadow cast by turning:

content: 18 Because he was so minded he hath brought us forth with a word of truth, To the end we should be a sort of firstfruit of his creatures.
content_old: 18 Because he was so minded he hath brought us forth with a word of truth, To the end we should be a sort of firstfruit of his creatures.

content: 19 Ye know､ my brethren beloved,— But let every man be swift to hear､ slow to speak､ slow to anger,
content_old: 19 Ye know､ my brethren beloved,— But let every man be swift to hear､ slow to speak､ slow to anger,

content: 20 For man’s anger worketh not God’s righteousness.
content_old: 20 For man’s anger worketh not God’s righteousness.

content: 21 Wherefore putting away all filthiness and overflow of baseness In meekness welcome ye the word fitted for inward growth､ which is able to save your souls:
content_old: 21 Wherefore putting away all filthiness and overflow of baseness In meekness welcome ye the word fitted for inward growth､ which is able to save your souls:

content: 22 Become ye doers of the word､ and not hearers only— Reasoning yourselves astray;
content_old: 22 Become ye doers of the word､ and not hearers only— Reasoning yourselves astray;

content: 23 Because if any is a word-hearer､ and not a doer The same is like unto a man observing his natural face in a mirror,—
content_old: 23 Because if any is a word-hearer､ and not a doer The same is like unto a man observing his natural face in a mirror,—

content: 24 For he observed himself､ and is gone away, and straightway it hath escaped him—What manner of man he was!
content_old: 24 For he observed himself､ and is gone away, and straightway it hath escaped him—What manner of man he was!

content: 25 But he that hath obtained a nearer view into the perfect law of liberty､ And hath taken up his abode by it, Becoming—not a forgetful hearer but a work doer The same happy in his doing shall be.
content_old: 25 But he that hath obtained a nearer view into the perfect law of liberty､ And hath taken up his abode by it, Becoming—not a forgetful hearer but a work doer The same happy in his doing shall be.

content: 26 If any thinketh he is observant of religion, Not curbing his own tongue､ But deceiving his own heart This one’s religious observance is vain:
content_old: 26 If any thinketh he is observant of religion, Not curbing his own tongue､ But deceiving his own heart This one’s religious observance is vain:

content: 1 My brethren, do not with respect for persons be holding the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ the Lord of gIory.
content_old: 1 My brethren, do not with respect for persons be holding the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ the Lord of gIory.

content: 2 For if there enter into your synagogue a man wearing gold rings in gay clothing, And there enter a destitute man also､ in soiled clothing,—
content_old: 2 For if there enter into your synagogue a man wearing gold rings in gay clothing, And there enter a destitute man also､ in soiled clothing,—

content: 3 And ye eye him that hath on the gay clothing､ and say, Thou be sitting here､ pleasantly,— And unto the destitute man say— Thou stand､ or sit there under my footstool
content_old: 3 And ye eye him that hath on the gay clothing､ and say, Thou be sitting here､ pleasantly,— And unto the destitute man say— Thou stand､ or sit there under my footstool

content: 4 Would ye not have been led to make distinctions among yourselves､ and have become judges with wicked reasonings?
content_old: 4 Would ye not have been led to make distinctions among yourselves､ and have become judges with wicked reasonings?

content: 5 Hearken! my brethren beloved:— Hath not God chosen the destitute in the world To be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?
content_old: 5 Hearken! my brethren beloved:— Hath not God chosen the destitute in the world To be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?

content: 6 Whereas ye have dishonoured the destitute man! Do not the rich oppress you? And themselves drag you into courts of justice?
content_old: 6 Whereas ye have dishonoured the destitute man! Do not the rich oppress you? And themselves drag you into courts of justice?

content: 7 Do not they defame the noble name which hath been invoked upon you?
content_old: 7 Do not they defame the noble name which hath been invoked upon you?

content: 8 If ye are indeed fulfilling a royal law, according to the scripture— Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself Nobly are ye doing;
content_old: 8 If ye are indeed fulfilling a royal law, according to the scripture— Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself Nobly are ye doing;

content: 9 But if ye are shewing respect of persons Sin are ye working､ Being convicted by the law as transgressors!
content_old: 9 But if ye are shewing respect of persons Sin are ye working､ Being convicted by the law as transgressors!

content: 10 For a man who shall keep the whole law But shall stumble in one thing Hath become for all things liable,—
content_old: 10 For a man who shall keep the whole law But shall stumble in one thing Hath become for all things liable,—

content: 11 For he that hath said—Do not commit adultery Hath also said—Do not commit murder,— Now if thou dost not commit adultery､ But dost commit murder Thou hast become a transgressor of law.
content_old: 11 For he that hath said—Do not commit adultery Hath also said—Do not commit murder,— Now if thou dost not commit adultery､ But dost commit murder Thou hast become a transgressor of law.

content: 12 So be speaking､ and so doing, As they who through means of a law of freedom are about to be judged;
content_old: 12 So be speaking､ and so doing, As they who through means of a law of freedom are about to be judged;

content: 13 For the judgment will be without mercy､ unto him that hath shewed no mercy: Mercy boasteth over judgments.
content_old: 13 For the judgment will be without mercy､ unto him that hath shewed no mercy: Mercy boasteth over judgments.

content: 14 What profit､ my brethren､— If one should be saying he hath faith､ but hath not works Can his faith save him?
content_old: 14 What profit､ my brethren､— If one should be saying he hath faith､ but hath not works Can his faith save him?

content: 15 If a brother or sister should be naked､ and coming short of the daily food,
content_old: 15 If a brother or sister should be naked､ and coming short of the daily food,

content: 16 And one from among you should say unto them— Withdraw in peace､ Be getting warmed and fed, But should not give them the things needful for the body What the profit?
content_old: 16 And one from among you should say unto them— Withdraw in peace､ Be getting warmed and fed, But should not give them the things needful for the body What the profit?

content: 17 So also faith if it have not works is dead by itself.
content_old: 17 So also faith if it have not works is dead by itself.

content: 18 But one will say— Thou hast faith､ And I have works, Shew me thy faith apart from thy works､ And I unto thee will shew by my works my faith.
content_old: 18 But one will say— Thou hast faith､ And I have works, Shew me thy faith apart from thy works､ And I unto thee will shew by my works my faith.

content: 19 Thou believest that God is one: Thou doest well—Even the demons believe､ and shudder!
content_old: 19 Thou believest that God is one: Thou doest well—Even the demons believe､ and shudder!

content: 20 But art thou willing to learn､ O empty man! That faith､ apart from works is idle?
content_old: 20 But art thou willing to learn､ O empty man! That faith､ apart from works is idle?

content: 21 Abraham our father Was it not by works he was declared righteous— When he offered Isaac his son upon the altar?
content_old: 21 Abraham our father Was it not by works he was declared righteous— When he offered Isaac his son upon the altar?

content: 22 Thou seest that his faith had been working together with his works, And by his works did his faith become full-grown,—
content_old: 22 Thou seest that his faith had been working together with his works, And by his works did his faith become full-grown,—

content: 23 And the scripture was fulfilled which saith— And Abraham believed God､ And it was reckoned to him as righteousness, And God’s friend was he called:
content_old: 23 And the scripture was fulfilled which saith— And Abraham believed God､ And it was reckoned to him as righteousness, And God’s friend was he called:

content: 24 Ye see that— By works a man is declared righteous, And not by faith alone.
content_old: 24 Ye see that— By works a man is declared righteous, And not by faith alone.

content: 25 And in like manner also､ Rahab the harlot Was it not by works she was declared righteous, When she gave welcome unto the messengers､ And by another way urged them forth?
content_old: 25 And in like manner also､ Rahab the harlot Was it not by works she was declared righteous, When she gave welcome unto the messengers､ And by another way urged them forth?

content: 1 Not many teachers become ye､ my brethren, Knowing that a severer sentence shall ye receive;
content_old: 1 Not many teachers become ye､ my brethren, Knowing that a severer sentence shall ye receive;

content: 2 For oft are we stumbling､ one and all: If anyone in word doth not stumble The same is a mature man, Able to curb even the whole body.
content_old: 2 For oft are we stumbling､ one and all: If anyone in word doth not stumble The same is a mature man, Able to curb even the whole body.

content: 3 Now if the horses bits into their mouths we thrust､ to the end they may be yielding to us Their whole body also do we turn about.
content_old: 3 Now if the horses bits into their mouths we thrust､ to the end they may be yielding to us Their whole body also do we turn about.

content: 4 Lo! the ships also large as they are､ and by rough winds driven along Are turned about by a very small helm､ Whithersoever the impulse of the steers-man inclineth.
content_old: 4 Lo! the ships also large as they are､ and by rough winds driven along Are turned about by a very small helm､ Whithersoever the impulse of the steers-man inclineth.

content: 5 So､ also､ the tongue is a little member and yet of great things maketh boast. Lo! how small a fire kindleth how great a forest;
content_old: 5 So､ also､ the tongue is a little member and yet of great things maketh boast. Lo! how small a fire kindleth how great a forest;

content: 6 And the tongue is a fire,— As the world of unrighteousness the tongue becometh fixed among our members, That which defileth the whole body And setteth on fire the wheel of our natural life､ And is set on fire by gehenna!
content_old: 6 And the tongue is a fire,— As the world of unrighteousness the tongue becometh fixed among our members, That which defileth the whole body And setteth on fire the wheel of our natural life､ And is set on fire by gehenna!

content: 7 For every nature— Both of wild beasts and of birds､ Both of reptiles and of things in the sea Is to be tamed､ and hath been tamed､ by the human nature;
content_old: 7 For every nature— Both of wild beasts and of birds､ Both of reptiles and of things in the sea Is to be tamed､ and hath been tamed､ by the human nature;

content: 8 But the tongue none of mankind can tame,— A restless mischief! Full of deadly poison!
content_old: 8 But the tongue none of mankind can tame,— A restless mischief! Full of deadly poison!

content: 9 Therewith are we blessing our Lord and Father, And therewith we are cursing the men who after the likeness of God have been brought into being!
content_old: 9 Therewith are we blessing our Lord and Father, And therewith we are cursing the men who after the likeness of God have been brought into being!

content: 10 Out of the same mouth come forth blessing and cursing! Not meet my brethren､ for these things thus to be coming to pass!
content_old: 10 Out of the same mouth come forth blessing and cursing! Not meet my brethren､ for these things thus to be coming to pass!

content: 11 Doth the fountain out of the same opening teem forth the sweet and the bitter?
content_old: 11 Doth the fountain out of the same opening teem forth the sweet and the bitter?

content: 12 Is it possible､ my brethren､ for a fig-tree to produce olives, or a vine figs? Neither can salt water yield sweet.
content_old: 12 Is it possible､ my brethren､ for a fig-tree to produce olives, or a vine figs? Neither can salt water yield sweet.

content: 13 Who is wise and well-instructed-among you? Let him shew､ out of his comely behaviour､ his works, in meekness of wisdom.
content_old: 13 Who is wise and well-instructed-among you? Let him shew､ out of his comely behaviour､ his works, in meekness of wisdom.

content: 14 But if bitter jealousy ye have､ and rivalry､ in your hearts Be not boasting and shewing yourselves false against the truth!
content_old: 14 But if bitter jealousy ye have､ and rivalry､ in your hearts Be not boasting and shewing yourselves false against the truth!

content: 15 This wisdom is not one from above coming down, But is earthly､ born of the soul､ demoniacal!
content_old: 15 This wisdom is not one from above coming down, But is earthly､ born of the soul､ demoniacal!

content: 16 For where jealousy and rivalry are There are anarchy and every ignoble deed.
content_old: 16 For where jealousy and rivalry are There are anarchy and every ignoble deed.

content: 17 But the wisdom from above is— First pure､ then peaceable､ reasonable､ easy to be entreated, fraught with mercy and good fruits, without partiality､ without hypocrisy.
content_old: 17 But the wisdom from above is— First pure､ then peaceable､ reasonable､ easy to be entreated, fraught with mercy and good fruits, without partiality､ without hypocrisy.

content: 1 Whence wars and whence fightings among you? Are they not from hence—due to your pleasures which are taking the field in your members?
content_old: 1 Whence wars and whence fightings among you? Are they not from hence—due to your pleasures which are taking the field in your members?

content: 2 Ye covet—and have not, Ye commit murder､ and are jealous､—and cannot obtain,— Ye fight and war. Ye have not— Because ye do not really ask,
content_old: 2 Ye covet—and have not, Ye commit murder､ and are jealous､—and cannot obtain,— Ye fight and war. Ye have not— Because ye do not really ask,

content: 3 Ye ask and receive not Because that basely ye ask, In order that in your pleasures ye may spend it.
content_old: 3 Ye ask and receive not Because that basely ye ask, In order that in your pleasures ye may spend it.

content: 4 Adulteresses! Know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity to God? Whosoever､ therefore､ is minded to be a friend of the world An enemy of God doth constitute himself.
content_old: 4 Adulteresses! Know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity to God? Whosoever､ therefore､ is minded to be a friend of the world An enemy of God doth constitute himself.

content: 5 Or think ye that in vain the scripture speaketh? Is it for envying that the spirit which hath taken an abode within us doth crave?
content_old: 5 Or think ye that in vain the scripture speaketh? Is it for envying that the spirit which hath taken an abode within us doth crave?

content: 6 Howbeit he giveth greater favour. Wherefore it saith— God against the haughty arrayeth himself, Whereas unto the lowly he giveth favour.
content_old: 6 Howbeit he giveth greater favour. Wherefore it saith— God against the haughty arrayeth himself, Whereas unto the lowly he giveth favour.

content: 7 Range yourselves､ therefore､ under God, But withstand the adversary､ And he will flee from you:
content_old: 7 Range yourselves､ therefore､ under God, But withstand the adversary､ And he will flee from you:

content: 8 Draw near unto God､ And he will draw near unto you. Cleanse hands､ sinners! Chasten hearts､ double souls!
content_old: 8 Draw near unto God､ And he will draw near unto you. Cleanse hands､ sinners! Chasten hearts､ double souls!

content: 9 Be miserable and lament and weep, Let your laughter into lamentation be turned､ And your joy into dejection;
content_old: 9 Be miserable and lament and weep, Let your laughter into lamentation be turned､ And your joy into dejection;

content: 10 Be made low in presence of the Lord､ And he will lift you up.
content_old: 10 Be made low in presence of the Lord､ And he will lift you up.

content: 11 Be not speaking one against another､ brethren! He that speaketh against a brother､ Or judgeth his brother Speaketh against law､ And judgeth law; Now if upon law thou art passing judgment Thou art not a doer of law､ but a judge!
content_old: 11 Be not speaking one against another､ brethren! He that speaketh against a brother､ Or judgeth his brother Speaketh against law､ And judgeth law; Now if upon law thou art passing judgment Thou art not a doer of law､ but a judge!

content: 12 One is Lawgiver and Judge—He who hath power to save and to destroy; But who art thou that judgest thy neighbour?
content_old: 12 One is Lawgiver and Judge—He who hath power to save and to destroy; But who art thou that judgest thy neighbour?

content: 13 Come now! ye that say— To-day or To-morrow we will journey unto this city here, And will spend there a year､ And will trade and get gain,—
content_old: 13 Come now! ye that say— To-day or To-morrow we will journey unto this city here, And will spend there a year､ And will trade and get gain,—

content: 14 Men who are not versed in the morrow—Of what sort your life will be; For ye are a vapour— For a little appearing､ Then just disappearing!
content_old: 14 Men who are not versed in the morrow—Of what sort your life will be; For ye are a vapour— For a little appearing､ Then just disappearing!

content: 15 Instead of your saying— If the Lord be pleased We shall both live､ and do this or that;
content_old: 15 Instead of your saying— If the Lord be pleased We shall both live､ and do this or that;

content: 16 Whereas now are ye boasting in your pretensions:— All boasting like this is wicked,
content_old: 16 Whereas now are ye boasting in your pretensions:— All boasting like this is wicked,

content: 1 Come now! ye wealthy! Weep ye､ howling, for your hardships which are coming upon you:
content_old: 1 Come now! ye wealthy! Weep ye､ howling, for your hardships which are coming upon you:

content: 2 Your wealth hath rotted, And your garments have become moth-eaten,—
content_old: 2 Your wealth hath rotted, And your garments have become moth-eaten,—

content: 3 Your gold and silver have rusted away, And their rust shall be witness against you, And shall eat your flesh､ as fire! Ye have laid up treasure in days of extremity:—
content_old: 3 Your gold and silver have rusted away, And their rust shall be witness against you, And shall eat your flesh､ as fire! Ye have laid up treasure in days of extremity:—

content: 4 Lo the wage of the workersers who have cut down your fields— That which hath been kept back by you is crying out; And the outcries of them who reaped Into the ears of the Lord of hosts have entered:
content_old: 4 Lo the wage of the workersers who have cut down your fields— That which hath been kept back by you is crying out; And the outcries of them who reaped Into the ears of the Lord of hosts have entered:

content: 5 Ye have luxuriated upon the land､ and run riot, Ye have pampered your hearts in a day of slaughter;
content_old: 5 Ye have luxuriated upon the land､ and run riot, Ye have pampered your hearts in a day of slaughter;

content: 6 Ye sentenced—ye murdered the Righteous one! Is he not arraying himself against you?
content_old: 6 Ye sentenced—ye murdered the Righteous one! Is he not arraying himself against you?

content: 7 Be patient､ therefore､ brethren､ until the Presence of the Lord:— Lo! the husbandman awaiteth the precious fruit of the earth, Having patience for it､ until it receive the early and the latter rain:
content_old: 7 Be patient､ therefore､ brethren､ until the Presence of the Lord:— Lo! the husbandman awaiteth the precious fruit of the earth, Having patience for it､ until it receive the early and the latter rain:

content: 8 Be ye also patient､ Stablish your hearts, Because the Presence of the Lord hath drawn near.
content_old: 8 Be ye also patient､ Stablish your hearts, Because the Presence of the Lord hath drawn near.

content: 9 Be not sighing､ brethren､ one against another, lest ye be judged,— Lo! the Judge before the doors is standing.
content_old: 9 Be not sighing､ brethren､ one against another, lest ye be judged,— Lo! the Judge before the doors is standing.

content: 10 An example take ye､ brethren､ of distress and patience,— The prophets who have spoken in the name of the Lord.
content_old: 10 An example take ye､ brethren､ of distress and patience,— The prophets who have spoken in the name of the Lord.

content: 11 Lo! we pronounce them happy who have endured;— Of the endurance of Job ye have heard, And the end of the Lord have ye seen,— That of much tender affection is the Lord､ and full of compassion
content_old: 11 Lo! we pronounce them happy who have endured;— Of the endurance of Job ye have heard, And the end of the Lord have ye seen,— That of much tender affection is the Lord､ and full of compassion

content: 12 But before all things my brethren､ do not swear,— Either by heaven､ or by the earth､ or by any other oath; But let your Yea be yea, And your Nay nay,— Lest under judgment ye fall.
content_old: 12 But before all things my brethren､ do not swear,— Either by heaven､ or by the earth､ or by any other oath; But let your Yea be yea, And your Nay nay,— Lest under judgment ye fall.

content: 13 In distress is any among you? Let him pray; Cheerful is any? Let him strike the strings;
content_old: 13 In distress is any among you? Let him pray; Cheerful is any? Let him strike the strings;

content: 14 Sick is any among you? Let him call unto him the elders of the assembly, And let them pray for him､ Anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord;—
content_old: 14 Sick is any among you? Let him call unto him the elders of the assembly, And let them pray for him､ Anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord;—

content: 15 And the prayer of faith shall save the exhausted one, And the Lord will raise him up, And if he have committed sins it shall be forgiven him.
content_old: 15 And the prayer of faith shall save the exhausted one, And the Lord will raise him up, And if he have committed sins it shall be forgiven him.

content: 16 Be openly confessing､ therefore､ one to another your sins, And be praying in each other’s behalf,— That ye may be healed. Much availeth the supplication of a righteous man､ when it is energised:
content_old: 16 Be openly confessing､ therefore､ one to another your sins, And be praying in each other’s behalf,— That ye may be healed. Much availeth the supplication of a righteous man､ when it is energised:

content: 17 Elijab was a man affected like us; And he earnestly prayed that there might be no moisture, And there was no moisture on the land for three years and six months,—
content_old: 17 Elijab was a man affected like us; And he earnestly prayed that there might be no moisture, And there was no moisture on the land for three years and six months,—

content: 18 And again he prayed, And the heaven gave rain､ And the land shot up her fruit.
content_old: 18 And again he prayed, And the heaven gave rain､ And the land shot up her fruit.

content: 19 My brethren! If one among you be led to err from the truth､ and one turn him back
content_old: 19 My brethren! If one among you be led to err from the truth､ and one turn him back
